derivation.yuyuan_name: mid 17th cent.: shortening of eschalot, from French eschalotte, alteration of Old French eschaloigne (in Anglo-Norman French scaloun: see scallion)

entry.def: Shallots are small round vegetables that are the roots of a crop and are similar to onions. They have a strong taste and are used for flavouring other food.

means.word_mean: 1. aggregated bulb of the multiplier onion
2. type of onion plant producing small clustered mild-flavored bulbs used as seasoning
3. small mild-flavored onion- or garlic-like clustered bulbs used for seasoning
